name: Pair Script
description:
A simple sript for pairing up students at Code Fellows. Pair programming is heavily emphisized, and as TAs we wanted to make our job easier by writing a script.

Students are loaded from JSON and paired according to a simple algorithm that uses recursion. Then the pairs are displayed on the page. Quick and easy to use, this is going to be a big help for us.

name: Hoofit
description:
Hoofit is an app designed to help people, especially the visually-impaired, get around Seattle by walking. It features route mapping through Google Maps with warnings for missing sidewalks and representations of accessible signals, as well as destinations of interest in a walkable radius around a given point.

Created as a final project for Codefellows 301, development on this continues. Planned upgrades include Spanish language options, better route warnings, and more sets of data.

name: Portfolio
description:
This very web page!

I created this page as part of the CodeFellows 301 course. Everything you see here was created by me, under guidance of my instructors.

This page uses AJAX to load these projects, responsive web design to be viewable on as many devices as possible, and jQuery and CSS3 for the visuals. Clever, huh?

name: Time Parallax
description:
A quick set of animation experiments. I fiddled around with jQuery and CSS3 animations to create a view of the Epoch from Chrono Trigger flying over Guardia, with birds and randomized clouds.

All art assets copyright Squaresoft, Square-Enix.

name: Knit Chart
description:
My first attempt to teach myself some OO Javascript and more use of jQuery. It's pretty rough, but that's what happens when you're just starting out.

The idea was to create a small knit charter program for Fair Isle designs and lace. It features drag-and-droppable icons, color-changing, a user-defined grid, and printing.
